field Hockey hosts a pair of Michigan squads coming this weekend File PhotoThe Daily Campus

The No PERIOD  ranked UConn field hockey team will host Michigan State in their first home game of the season Friday at  p.m PERIOD at the George J PERIOD Sherman Family Sports Complex PERIOD The Huskies will also host No PERIOD  Michigan on Sunday at noon PERIOD

The Huskies are off to a strong start in their season after picking up a  win over No PERIOD  Northwestern and a  win over No PERIOD  Stanford PERIOD Big East Freshman of the week Karo Kueskes leads the team with three goals through the two victories while sophomore midfielder Jessica Dembrowski has recorded two goals for the Huskies PERIOD Junior forward Svea Booker freshman midfielder Abby Gooderham and fifth year back Cecile Pieper each have contributed three points PERIOD Sophomore goalkeeper Cheyenne Sprecher has allowed two goals on a . save average thus far PERIOD

Fridays opponent Michigan State lost its opening game  to Old Dominion but defeated Kent State  in overtime PERIOD Aisha Osinga Isa van der Weij and Kelsey Keener each have scored one goal to lead the team while goalkeeper Jade Arundell has recorded  saves PERIOD

Sundays opponent No PERIOD  Michigan lost its first two games of the season last weekend PERIOD The Wolverines were beaten  by No PERIOD  North Carolina and were upset by No PERIOD  Wake Forest  PERIOD Halle Oneil leads the Wolverines with two goals PERIOD In the cage the Wolverines have featured both Sidonie LaPlante . save average and Anna Spieker . save average PERIOD

UConn is favored in both games this weekend PERIOD

Story Salit is a campus correspondent for The Daily Campus and can be reached via email at story.salituconn.edu PERIOD
